column2: WISCONSIN DMV TEST
column4: Wisconsin

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text

column2: 1. When entering an interstate highway, drivers should:
column4: come to a complete stop, check for cars and enter when safe to do so.
column6: wait for an opening in traffic on the entrance ramp.
column8: adjust speed to meet a traffic gap, then merge at a safe speed.
column10: check for cars and slow down to 25 MPH before merging with the flow of traffic.

column2: 2. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: try pumping it to increase pressure.
column6: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.
column8: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 3. When you get in a car to drive, the first thing you should do is:
column4: adjust your seat belt.

column2: 4. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Pull the steering wheel back.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column10: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: Bicycles cross or ride beside traffic
column8: Bicycles have the same rights as other vehicles

column2: 7. Which statement about blind spots is true?
column4: If traffic conditions permit you should cruise in blind spot of the vehicle ahead.
column6: Large trucks have smaller blind spots than most passenger vehicles.
column8: Before changing lanes, you should check mirrors and look over your shoulder toward the rear.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: Traffic is entering from another road, drive with caution

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: Two way left turn
column8: Traffic must move only in the direction of the arrow

column2: 10. When they approach this sign, drivers must:
column4: slow down and watch for children crossing the road.

column2: 11. When driving in travel lanes on the roadway:
column4: do not stop for any reason, keep moving until you can safely pull off the road.
column6: you may make a U-turn if you get on the wrong entrance ramp of the freeway.
column8: you may stop to let out passengers.
column10: you may make back up quickly if there are no vehicles behind.

column2: 12. A solid yellow line next to a broken yellow line means that vehicles:
column4: next to the broken line may pass.
column8: next to the solid line may pass.

column2: 13. When you see this sign you should stop and:
column4: yield the right-of way to all vehicles that arrive after you.
column6: yield the right-of way to all vehicles coming from the left.
column8: check for vehicles in the opposite direction, then proceed.
column10: check traffic in all direction before proceeding.

column2: 14. Drivers must stay at least _______ behind a snowplow with its red or amber lights on:
column4: 300 feet

column2: 15. There is no crosswalk and a pedestrian is crossing your lane ahead. You should:
column4: make eye contact and then pass the pedestrian.
column6: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.
column8: slow down as you pass the pedestrian.

column2: 16. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column6: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column8: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column10: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.

column2: 17. A thumping sound can be a warning:
column4: of a steering failure.
column8: that a tire blowout is about to occur.

column2: 18. When dust is blowing across the roadway making it difficult to see other vehicles, you should drive slower and turn on your:
column4: emergency flashers.

column2: 19. Who must wear seat belts?
column4: Only the driver.
column6: Only children under 16 years of age.

column2: 20. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop
column8: Drive with caution and be ready to stop

column2: 21. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column4: keeps other drivers alert.
column6: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.
column10: gives you time to react to situations.

column2: 22. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column4: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.

column2: 23. Does a vehicle prepared to enter a traffic circle or rotary have right-of-way over vehicles in the circle?
column4: No. Vehicles already in the circle have the right-of-way.
column6: Yes, but only if they are entering the rotary from the right lane.
column10: Only if the light is green.

column2: 24. The minimum drinking age in this State is ____ years.
25. Drivers may need more space in front of their vehicle:
column4: when it is hard to see ahead.
column6: when carrying a heavy load or pulling a trailer.

column2: 26. When you approach a railroad crossing without flashing warning signals or crossing gates, you should:
column4: always stop.
column6: cross the tracks as slowly as possible.
column8: speed up to beat the train.
column10: yield to all trains at the crossing.

column2: 27. If you are continually being passed on the right, you should:
column4: move into the right lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the left.
column6: pull over to the right and stop until the road is clear.
column8: move into the left lane and allow other vehicles to pass you on the right.

column2: 28. Your BAC depends on:
column4: the amount of alcohol you drink.
column8: the type of beverage you drink.

column2: 29. At intersections marked with stop lines, drivers must:
column4: enter the intersection and then stop.
column10: slow down and enter the intersection.

column2: 30. If you are going slow down where another driver does not expect you to:
column4: quickly tap the brake pedal several times.
column6: use hand signals to alert the other driver.
column8: sound your horn to alert the other driver.

column2: 31. This road sign means:
column4: Always come to a complete stop
column6: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way
column8: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging

column2: 32. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column4: It helps increase your stopping distance.

column2: 33. Under ideal driving conditions, drivers should allow at least ___ seconds between their vehicle and the vehicle ahead.
34. This road sign means:
column4: Do not enter

column2: 35. This road sign means:
column4: Merge

column2: 36. Drivers who have been drinking are more likely to:
column4: keep a safe following distance.

column2: 37. On roads with two lanes traveling in the same direction, drivers should keep to the:
column4: left lane to avoid vehicles entering the road.
column10: right lane only when they plan to exit.

column2: 38. This sign means:
column4: Business area nearby. Watch for business people.
column6: The driver is near a school and should watch for children.
column10: There is a work zone ahead. Watch for workers.

column2: 39. Are drivers allowed to exceed the speed limit to pass other vehicles?
column4: Yes, but only by 10 MPH or less.
column10: Yes, but only if they drive with caution.

column2: 40. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column4: vehicles from both directions.

column2: 41. At a light rail intersection, you should always:
column4: share the road with pedestrians and bicyclists.
column6: look both ways before crossing the tracks.
column8: be alert and obey all traffic signals.

column2: 42. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp curves ahead

column2: 43. This sign means:
column4: no turns are allowed on this road.
column10: the road may be slippery when wet.

column2: 44. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Hospital service
column10: Area reserved for people with disabilities

column2: 45. This warning sign means:
column4: Watch out for children crossing the street
column8: Slow down, drive with caution and watch for children

column2: 46. This signal means:
column4: Stop

column2: 47. Your driving ability can be affected by:
column4: three drinks or more.

column2: 48. This road sign means:
column4: Prepare to stop

column2: 49. This road sign means:
column4: No left turn

column2: 50. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column6: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.
